Big Run State Park Campground, MD, USA

USA, Maryland
Detailed information on camping at Big Run State Park, Maryland, USA.
Published

September 18, 2023

Camping is an age-old tradition that allows us to connect with nature, unwind from the hustle and bustle of daily life, and create lasting memories with loved ones. One of the best places to experience the great outdoors in Maryland is Big Run State Park. Nestled in the heart of the state, this park offers a unique camping experience for both seasoned campers and first-timers.

Big Run State Park spans over 300 acres and is located at the southeastern base of Backbone Mountain. The park is surrounded by lush forests, serene lakes, and offers a picturesque view of the Savage River Reservoir. It’s a haven for nature lovers, offering a tranquil setting away from city life.

Address and Website

  • Address: 10368 Savage River Rd, Swanton, MD 21561, USA
  • Website: Maryland Department of Natural Resources - Big Run State Park

Things to Do

  1. Hiking: The park boasts several miles of hiking trails, ranging from easy to challenging. These trails offer breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes.
  2. Fishing: The Savage River Reservoir is a popular spot for fishing. Anglers can expect to catch a variety of fish including bass, trout, and perch.
  3. Boating: Bring your kayak or canoe and paddle through the calm waters of the reservoir.
  4. Picnicking: There are several picnic areas equipped with tables and grills, perfect for a family outing.
  5. Wildlife Viewing: The park is home to diverse wildlife, including deer, birds, and small mammals.

Best Time of the Year to Visit

The ideal time to visit Big Run State Park is during the spring and fall months. During these times, the weather is mild, the foliage is vibrant, and the park is less crowded. Summer is also a popular time, especially for water activities, but expect larger crowds.

Family and Pet Friendliness

Big Run State Park is a family-friendly destination. There are playgrounds for kids and open spaces for them to run around and play. Pets are also welcome in the park, but they must be kept on a leash at all times. There are designated pet-friendly areas and trails where you can take your furry friend for a walk.

Types of Campsites and Amenities

  • Tent Sites: Basic sites with a flat area for tents, a fire ring, and a picnic table.
  • RV Sites: These sites come with electric hookups and are spacious enough to accommodate large RVs.
  • Cabins: For those who prefer a bit more comfort, the park offers cabins equipped with basic amenities.

Amenities:

  • Restrooms with showers
  • Potable water stations
  • Dump station for RVs
  • Firewood for sale
  • Boat launch area

Safety Tips

  1. Wildlife: While it’s exciting to spot wildlife, always maintain a safe distance. Never feed or approach wild animals.
  2. Fire Safety: Always put out campfires completely before leaving the site or going to bed.
  3. Stay on Marked Trails: When hiking, stick to the marked trails to avoid getting lost.
  4. Weather: Check the weather forecast before your trip. Be prepared for sudden changes, especially if you’re planning to be on the water.
  5. Emergency Numbers: Keep a list of emergency numbers, including the park office, handy.

Conclusion

Big Run State Park is a gem in Maryland’s crown of natural wonders. Whether you’re looking for a weekend getaway or an extended stay, this park offers something for everyone. Remember to respect nature, follow the safety guidelines, and most importantly, enjoy the beauty and tranquility that Big Run State Park has to offer. Happy camping!
